hints.content:
We can find the number of laundry loads by dividing the total amount of detergent $(\maroonD{21} \text { fluid ounces})$ by the number of fluid ounces needed for each load $(\blueD{3} \text { fluid ounces})$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The longer top rectangle is labeled 21. The shorter bottom rectangle is labeled 3. A curved bracket at the bottom of both rectangles is labeled with question mark equal groups. !

hints.content: $\greenD{7 \text {}}$ loads of laundry can be washed with the Soapy Suds laundry detergent bottle.

question.content:
Soapy Suds laundry detergent comes in a $21 \text{}$ fluid ounce bottle.  Each load of laundry with Soapy Suds uses $3$ fluid ounces of detergent.  
  
**How many loads of laundry can be washed with a bottle of Soapy Suds laundry detergent?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] loads
